title: Climax
review: I really enjoyed this and it was refreshingly different from other typical horrors. Like in Enter The Void, the camera floats around ethereally near the ceiling as chaos descends below, with every character is stuck in a personal hell. There are a lot of characters and I was confused about who was who at the start, but by the end I'd learned about all their innermost fears and traumas. Gaspar No√© likes a credit sequence so much he put one about half way through this movie, and it even starts with the end credits in a weird and fun way.
